resources.string:
This simple app is for developers only. 
 
It allows you to read and write the clipboard of the Android device using ADB commands. 
See also scripts in the Github repository: 
github.com/PRosenb/AdbClipboard 
 
No need to keep this screen open. The app will be started in the background when you execute the ADB command. 
 
Read clipboard: 
adb shell am broadcast -n "ch.pete.adbclipboard/.ReadReceiver" 
 
It returns the content of the clipboard in the "data" element. 
 
Write clipboard: 
adb shell am broadcast -n "ch.pete.adbclipboard/.WriteReceiver" -e text "urlEncodedString" 
 
If you use spaces, the string needs to be url encoded.
